item.title: Item adding issue
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

djs15:

oh my bad about the int thing im new to this i just kinda saw a link that said ints… bahaha and how do i find the correct rotation values then?

If they’re not documented already, you’ll have to either test them all out for yourself, or dump the values from a client that has the item (if it’s a new client, then it will be a hell of a time)

Read full topic

item.title: Item adding issue
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The values for the rotation aren’t correct.

Also, an int is a primitive data type. What you posted (and what other people have misnamed), is the definition, or context of the item attributes.

Read full topic

item.title: Item adding issue
item.dc:creator: @djs15 djs15
item.description:
@djs15 wrote:

So im using dragon history source and it seems like whenever i try to custom code an item like the dominion crossbow, it does not come out right.

here is the int

    case 20073:
	itemDef.modelid = 3839;
	itemDef.name = "Dominion crossbow";
	itemDef.description = "It's a " + itemDef.name;
	itemDef.modelZoom = 1480;
	itemDef.modelRotationY = 346;
	itemDef.modelRotationX = 801;
	itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
	itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
	itemDef.anInt165 = 2304;
	itemDef.anInt200 = 2304;
	itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
	itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
	itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
	itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
	itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Destroy";
	break;

it spawns fine and everything its just when you wield it you become a wied thing:

look at the the pic:

Read full topic
